As for the gay Republicans whose votes Mr. Bush might then lose, Mr. Weyrich wrote, "Good riddance."

 
 http://www.nytimes.com/2004/07/09/politics/09gays.html
 
 opinions?

Be tolerant to Bush because it's absolutely up to him. If I was a president of the United States of America, I would maybe do the same thing.
 
 Be tolerant. Isn't "tolerance" the key argument for gays?

Be tolerant. Isn't "tolerance" the key argument for gays?

 
 And so one must be tolerent of intolerence, or be hypocritcal? No, it doesn't work like that. The argument for gay rights is that gay should get the same rights as everyone else. The right to live where they want. The right to walk down the street without getting beaten up. The right to serve in the military if they want. 
 
 Bush is of course welcome to his opinion, but nobody has to accept it in the name of tolerence. He's an elected official, and it's the duty of every American to stand up and shout if they think their elected officials are doing something wrong.

Votes all count the same...everyone gets one and they all count equally.
 
 I wasn't voting for him anyway.
